bibl.title: Dispatch from du Verge to William Hunter
Despatches from United States consuls in St. Paul de Loanda, 1854-1893

revisionDesc.change: Creation of individual xml files, review, and addition encoding

div1.p: Consulate of the United States of America at St Paul de Loandas W.C.A.
L de R. de Verge to State Department Washington D.C.
Incloses Acknowledgment of the same and trade on Petroleum.
United States Consulate St Paul de Loanda December 7th 1882
Hon: W: Hunter Acting Secretary of State Washington D.C.

Sir I have the honor to acknowledge the receipt of your 2 circulars dated Sept 5th and 13th 1882. In answer to your circular of Sept. 13th I would respectfully state that I have already brought the subject before the civil and military goods of Angola with the Islands of St. Thome and Princess included, offering them the best of refined Petroleum for city and military use, as mentioned to the state Dept. in my despatch No 6. that Kerosene oil was in great demand here and all over this coast. But the shippers and masters of am: vessels should be very careful how they deal with the whites and blacks of this part of the country, Am: commerce has almost been down by Am: shippers and own fault, as reported in my despatch no 17. Another important trade will soon be of farming implements of all kinds.
I have the honor to be Sir Your obedient servant L de R. du Verge U.S. Consul.
